docs.title: GitHub App Installer - hubapp
docs.text: The hubapp command line tool lets you install app binaries from github user's releases. Once installed, simply select the version you require from the dropdown and start using the downloaded github user's app.

docs.title: Step by step instructions
docs.text:
An open source project becomes meaningful when people collaborate to improve the code.

Feel free to look at the code, critique and make suggestions. Lets make hubapp better!

docs.title: Required version
docs.text: go version 1.13

docs.title: Step 1 - Create workspace
docs.text: Skip this step if you already have a github go workspace Create a github workspace.

docs.title: Step 2 - Set GOPATH
docs.text:
Skip this step if you already have a github go workspace Export your GOPATH environment variable in your go directory.

export GOPATH=`pwd`

docs.title: Step 3 - Clone repository
docs.text:
Git clone this repository.

git clone git@github.com:warrensbox/hubapp.git

docs.title: Step 4 - Get dependencies
docs.text:
Go get all the dependencies.

go mod download

go get -v -t -d ./...

Test the code (optional).

go vet -tests=false ./...

go test -v ./...

docs.title: Step 5 - Build executable
docs.text:
Create a new branch.

git checkout -b feature/put-your-branch-name-here

Refactor and add new features to the code. Go build the code.

go build -o test-hubapp
chmod +x test-hubapp
./test-hubapp --help

Test the code and create a new pull request!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: hubapp is available for MacOS and Linux based operating systems.

docs.title: Homebrew
docs.text:
Installation for MacOS is the easiest with Homebrew. If you do not have homebrew installed, click here. 

brew install warrensbox/tap/hubapp

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
Installation for other linux operation systems.

curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/warrensbox/hubapp/release/install.sh | bash

docs.title: Install from source
docs.text: Alternatively, you can install the binary from source here

docs.title: Use dropdown menu to select version
docs.text:
1. You can install and switch between different versions of github user's app by typing the command hubapp install user/repo on your terminal.
  2. Select the version of binary by using the up and down arrow.
  3. Hit Enter to install the desired version.

The most recently selected versions are presented at the top of the dropdown.

docs.title: Upgrade current version
docs.text:
1. You can also upgrade to latest version of the app.
  2. For example, hubapp upgrade user/repo to upgrade to a higher version of the app.
  3. Hit Enter to upgrade.

docs.title: Uninstall GitHub app
docs.text:
1. You can also uninstalled github user's.
  2. For example, hubapp upgrade user/repo to uninstall to a higher version of the app.
  3. Hit Enter to uninstall.

docs.title: Troubleshoot
docs.text:
Common issues:

install: can't change permissions of /usr/local/bin: Operation not permitted

"Unable to remove symlink. You must have SUDO privileges"

"Unable to create symlink. You must have SUDO privileges"

You probably need to have sudo privileges to install hubapp.

docs.title: Homebrew
docs.text: brew upgrade warrensbox/tap/hubapp

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
Rerun:

curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/warrensbox/hubapp/release/install.sh | bash

docs.title: Homebrew
docs.text: brew uninstall warrensbox/tap/hubapp

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
Rerun:

rm /usr/local/bin/hubapp
